text.p: These are the leading stories in the Skopje press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Medicines in Macedonia are three times more expensive than in Bulgaria. Macedonian citizens are revolted since state pharmacies, meant to sell subsidised low-cost drugs, are practically empty while private ones are well stocked with overpriced medicaments.
- New electoral law in Macedonia to be passed by the end of the year. The third parliamentary elections in 1998 to be held according to new rules.
- "The international community must intervene in Albania. Albanian President Sali Berisha is not capable to calm the situation in the country," Nova Makedonija says in a commentary.
- NATO Secretary General Javier Solana to visit Macedonia in the last week of March at the invitation of Macedonian foreign minister Ljubomir Frckovski.

- Rector of the Kiril and Metodi University in Skopje Radmila Kiprijanova calls on students from the teachers academy to stop hunger strike and try to resolve the problem through dialogue with the government. Hunger strike continues and traffic in central Skpoje blocked almost all day. -- Mircela Casule, Skopje newsroom +389 91 201 196
